content: Sports venue in Jurong, Singapore **Jurong Stadium** was a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) in [Jurong](/wiki/Jurong), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), the stadium held 8,000 people. ## History It was used mostly for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches and was the home stadium of [Sinchi FC](/wiki/Sinchi_FC) when they played in the [S.League](/wiki/S.League) from 2003 to 2005. Previously, [Warriors FC](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_FC) (then known as Singapore Armed Forces ) also played their home games in the stadium, before moving to [Choa Chu Kang Stadium](/wiki/Choa_Chu_Kang_Stadium). In February 2020, Jurong Stadium was fenced up, before being demolished in March 2020, with demolition ending in the same month. ## International football matches DateCompetitionTeam 1Res.Team 226 November 2008Friendly [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)2â€“2 [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam_national_football_team) - "Jurong Stadium is a place in Singapore or JB on the Map of Singapore + Johor". Retrieved 18 June 2010. This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Jurong Stadium
